website_summaries.verdict: Heavy-duty enough for really tough meat, such as wild game and larger fowl. Plunger can be challenging to push, so we do not recommend it for those with hand strength issues.
pros: Silicone O-rings form strong, leak-resistant seal
Heavy gauge stainless steel penetrates meat easily
Works with both wet and dry marinade blends
cons: O-rings may not tolerate high heat conditions
Plunger can be difficult to depress
Solid marinade ingredients can get trapped in barrel

website_summaries.verdict: Easy to use, easy to clean, and will last a long time.
pros: Includes two needles, one for liquid marinades and one for minced marinades
Easy to use, even for beginners
cons: Some buyers say the plunger fits very tightly into the tube and recommend greasing it first

customer_reviews.title: The perfect food injector.
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying that I don't know what took me so long to find this. For years, every stinking year I bought a glass or plastic syringe to shoot the turkey up with homemade turkey stock at Thanksgiving. Every stinking year the glass or plastic would crack by the last baste if not before. This year I found this one. Worked perfectly, washed up great with a bottle brush and is very heavy duty. No glass or plastic to break. I will probably have this for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super heavy duty stainless steel
customer_reviews.text: Super heavy duty stainless steel marinade injector. This is by far the best one I have ever owned. It is easy to load and use and will last years as it is a quality made product. The two types of needles on it allow for both straight liquid injections and larger holes allowing for minced herbs to be injected. I did not have to puree everything before I put the garlic marinade into the turkey. Great great product. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: OregonJeepGirl

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable, stopped working when I needed it most
customer_reviews.text: Initially, I was impressed by the construction. It gives the impression that the item will last and function for a long time. However, by the 3rd use, the slide had seemingly become too large for the chamber. It took some serious effort to get the plunger back into the unit, and operating the device took two hands and patience. By the 5th use, the suction was lost from the injector. It could no longer draw liquid, hold liquid, or inject liquid. All this while I had a 13 lb brisket ready to cook! Closer inspection showed the rubber gasket surrounding the plunger had torn, making a vacuum impossible. Thought I bought quality, now I have to eat a dry brisket.
customer_reviews.author: Lost Ramblin

customer_reviews.title: Great for doping the turkey
customer_reviews.text: OMG the Turkey was great. I made "Turkey Dope" and shot it up on Monday and cooked it on Thursday. Lovely Thanksgiving bird. It was moist and delicious, everyone really liked it leaving not too much as leftovers. For a medium sized bird, about 16 pounds....a stick of salted butter, 1/2 teaspoon ground sage, 1 tablespoon of McCormick Poultry Seasoning (Thyme, Sage, Marjoram, Rosemary, Black Pepper and Nutmeg.) 1 teaspoons of salt, 1/2 teaspoon of pepper and 1/2 tsp of onion powder. Melted and mixed together and then this dope was injected in multiple spots with lots into the legs. It seems to have moved through the bird and everything was just right.
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: My old (cheap) plastic injector was toast, so, I finally broke down and bought this one. Wow! I lubricated the plunger with olive oil. Then I ran whole fresh parsley, along with rosemary, thyme, onion and orange juice through the blender. It all flowed through the injector into the turkey SO smoothly! I am eager to use it on my Prime Rib. It comes with extra gaskets for the needles and plunger. I must be careful to keep them with it. Disassembled, it cleaned up nicely in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Rudie Neumann

customer_reviews.title: injector works great for me
customer_reviews.text: this is a well made heavy duty stainless steal meat injector. this is so much better then the cheap plastic injectors I've been using wished I bought this years ago. the needles are 6" long & work very well. I don't see any problems with cross threading when putting together like one reviewer have stated I guess it could happen if your not careful. this injector works great just remember to keep the rubber seal oiled I use vegetable oil that way the seal won't roll up and come off. I think this was worth the money I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: JG (Highflyer)Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Need more needles
customer_reviews.text: The needles that come with this are worthless for injecting cuts of meat like brisket or pork. They are way too large, made for injecting more solid items mixed with liquid. They need to provide two smaller, more fine needles that only deliver liquid, that way the interior of the meat isn't completely torn apart by the bulkiness of the needle.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew J. Rowland

customer_reviews.title: Comes with replacement gaskets and great instructions
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy that I went with this injector vs other ones. I initially bought this one for the two different needles, but was pleasantly surprised when I opened the package to find additional replacement gaskets. If you've read reviews on various needles, you'll come to find out that gaskets are the #1 reason for failure for these style of injectors. Anyway, I've used my injector mulitple times with great success, this one was definitely worth the coin.
customer_reviews.author: DangerDonkey

customer_reviews.title: Dispenses juices just a bit difficult to work sometimes
customer_reviews.text: Okay so I like this, but I hate it too. Sometimes it gets stuck when I'm trying to pull it out, or push the juices/marinade in. It's heavy, so it's hard to do with one hand, so if you're working in the kitchen or at the grill alone it can be a pain. That being said my Turkey's and Rotisserie Chickens have never been so juicy and tasty, so it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: mrsbaybeeboom

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I recently got a smoker and ordered this for when we do poultry. There's a definite learning curve and the first time I used it I had injection everywhere but enough of it got inside the meat to make it taste wonderful and since then I've gotten the hang of it. It's a very well made product and should last many years.
customer_reviews.author: MeadowlarkMT

customer_reviews.title: Best Injector and priced just right
customer_reviews.text: The Bayou Classic Injector is amazing! Best Injector we have bought over the years. Used this several times on turkeys and each time it's been great. Injects smoothly, easy to push out your seasonings/liquid and extremely easy to clean. The needles twist off and with a little soap and water this set is good as new!
customer_reviews.author: Luciana A.

customer_reviews.title: Very Big
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastically well built injector. It’s heavy and well built. I was so excited when I got it. I took away a star because it’s so big, making it a bit unwieldy. I had to switch back to my old injector I got at the grocery store. I have smaller hands.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: If I bought the "Jellinator" for easy jello shot pouring I would've ended up with a ...
customer_reviews.text: I was making jello shots and didn't want to spend $23 on the "Jellinator" since I'm not a college bro and will probably never need to make jello shots again. Using this I filled up 64 2oz containers in about 5 minutes without spilling a drop, and as a plus, now I have a well made marinade and seasoning injector. If I bought the "Jellinator" for easy jello shot pouring I would've ended up with a $23 piece of plastic in the end that would end up in a land fill or cluttering up my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: GM

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I got this unit last week for marinating our Turkey . I am not sure if I should give it the five-star review..The packaging is great , no question of losing any pieces. It was an easy job to marinate a turkey. It comes with extra washers for the unit. If you are using a marinade that has butter , make sure the injector is warmed with hot water. The butter caked up inside the injector. Not an issue caused by the injector. The part I am not sure is should the needle detached from the head ? Mine came off as I was pulling it out of the turkey. Is it designed to come off for cleaning ?
customer_reviews.author: DVD

customer_reviews.title: Only used it once and so far it’s working great. I love how easy it is to use
customer_reviews.text: Only used it once and so far it’s working great. I love how easy it is to use. I still need to find a good to clean it though. Overall, so far I would recommend. Good product
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Injector for smoking meats.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic tool if you love smoking meats. The tips included allow you to have a marinade with grounded spice. It easily pierces meats. The tube is made of glass.
customer_reviews.author: The Gigler

customer_reviews.title: would buy it again if I had to
customer_reviews.text: We bought this after breaking several others that were glass or plastic. I'm very glad we spent the money and got this one. The two injector needles allows us to have variation in chunky v. non-chunky mixes. It is very easy to use with injection being smooth and non-jarring. It is also very easy to clean, and I don't have concerns about getting all of the junk out since it one piece. Update 2 years later: This thing is still working great. Definitely worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Pickles

customer_reviews.title: INJECTIONS THAT WORK!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when I bought the turkey fryer. This allowed me to injected my garlic sauce into the turkey and it works great. Stainless steel makes it easy to clean. There are two separate nozzles one for direct injection and the other to inject in the tip as well as the sides. I've used both. I found it worked well with: Turkey Chicken Roast Beef Roast Pork I even tried it on a Meatloaf and meatballs. Fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Edwin Dobbs * Dobbs Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this injector one time, to prepare a butt ham with a bourbon marinade. It worked very well, and I look forward to using it again for other meats.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wiskerchen

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty injector - works well for basic usage
customer_reviews.text: Used for Thanksgiving Turkey that we fried. Injected with marinade and the injector is heavy duty and had no issue piercing skin and meat of turkey. Easy to clean, robust seals, it is a nice unit. It is probably overkill and you could get away with the plastic injectors given away with most marinades, but I like to have tools that are top notch just in case. So if you want a solid injector, get it. If you plan on injecting a turkey or other meat every so often, you could save the money and use the plastic ones.
customer_reviews.author: Michigan Family

customer_reviews.title: This injector works great. It is very easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This injector works great. It is very easy to assemble, break down, and clean. I have been using this injector a lot and it has not leaked yet. I like the fact it comes with a perferated needle that can inject into multiple areas at once. Neither needle gets clogged from excessive use and they are both easy to clean since it is stainless steel. Would recommend this to anyone who does a lot of smoking.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Han

customer_reviews.title: It looks good on paper but does not hold up
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this injector along with the roast rack from another company. I have used product less than 4 times and it is no longer holding or having any suction from the injector needle. It has stripped out after only 4 times and using hand tightening. Very unhappy with this product and going to attempt a return/replacement. :: I am crossing my fingers :: Not happy as I was trying to cook a 4 pound chicken today and wasted most of my marinade as it leaked... It looks good on paper but does not hold up.
customer_reviews.author: wrking22000

customer_reviews.title: If I can give a negative star I would, ...
customer_reviews.text: If I can give a negative star I would, the threading to the syringe plunger end to the body stripped on the first attempt of putting it back together, how can that be you say? It did so by not seating properly. I was very carful with aligning the cap and body because I know if it's miss aligned it will get messed up and also not have any vacuum and the marinade will shoot back at me. Not pleasant if I'm doing a peppery injection.
customer_reviews.author: PCH Driver

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT LOOSE THE SILICONE RINGS
customer_reviews.text: When washing pay special attention to the rubber rings at the connection point, they can get lost easy in the sink.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: This seasoning injector was really better than I expected. It is of sturby construction and has a nice "heft" to it. I have injected both dry and wet seasonings with it and it has worked flawlessly every time. The needles are nice and long so you can get the seasoning where it needs to go. Clean up is pretty easy as the needles unscrew as shown in the picture. Not worth a start subtraction but worth noting that if your hands are on the small side it may be a little cumbersome, my girlfriend has rather small hands and has noted that this isnt the most comfortable thing to use.
customer_reviews.author: J1913

customer_reviews.title: Totally satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Received this injector today. I haven't even used it as yet, other than to test leakage with water, but I am wholly impressed. Heavy stainless steel, good heft, excellent silicone washers that make a tight seal. This thing is meant to work for generations. It comes with two complete sets of replacement washers for the plunger and both needles. I am a 100% satisfied customer. It is a fine thing to see (in this day and age of throwaway junk) an excellent product, designed well, manufactured to last, and at a fair price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ships with spare O-rings
customer_reviews.text: I usually don't write reviews of items that have been heavily reviewed in the past.Everything has already been said. However I decided to write this because some people were complaining that you may lose the o-rings and only realize you've lost them when you need the syringe. The Item we got comes with spare o-rings. If you tend to lose them in the dishwasher etc., chances are you'll lose the spare ones too. However these "first" spare ones allow you to continue using the syringe so you can order new ones in the meantime.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Damaged parts
customer_reviews.text: Appears to be of great quality and came in superb packaging. However, the gasket inside main cylinder came damaged. Will adjust rating if seller reaches out!
customer_reviews.author: David Laws

customer_reviews.title: Versatility, easy to use, easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: Versatile, I can inject chickens, prime ribs, Turkey's and much more. Can even use it to inject cakes. Just need to know what you are doing.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly White

customer_reviews.title: Stepped up our game
customer_reviews.text: After years of using the crappy free recycled injectors from buying pre-made marinade in the early years, I "splurged" on this.. WOW! Well worth the money and awesome product. Love the injector! Some reviews refer to the silicone rings.. there's a bag of replacements in the box. If I go through that many, I'll happily purchase a new syringe. It's sharp and works beautifully.. adds a flare to an already exciting process of prepping the turkeys for the fryer.
customer_reviews.author: Susan S.

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Whenever I need a hot meat injection I know this product will not fail me. Rock hard and the plunger never fails, you can plunge all night with this thing if you had the stamina.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: No cleaning brush!
customer_reviews.text: Misses a cleaning tool and not very easy to clean very thin tubes without specialized tool which some cases comes with on some other kits but not this one.
customer_reviews.author: Onr

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: My family and I have been frying turkeys for 20+ years. Every year we have to make a mess straining every little chunk out of our marinade with coffee filters and cheescloth. Not anymore!!! This baby is heavy duty, with a thick gauge needle that allows everything to pass through. The needle is strong stainless steel and the vial holds two ounces, making injecting a turkey quicker and easier than it's ever been. I definitely recommend this to anyone who fries turkey, or injectes marinades directy into their meats.
customer_reviews.author: BCJ

customer_reviews.title: Great for keeping your breasts moist!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for Thanksgiving turkey. After soaking the turkey in a salt brine over night, I then use this injector in addition to a baster throughout the cooking to keep my turkey moist. This is especially helpful for the breast, which as everyone knows can be a bit dry. Minus 1/2 a star for it sometimes being hard to move the plunger. When this happens I unscrew the cap and then put a little bit of oil (olive oil, turkey schmaltz, etc.) on the o-ring and this makes it easier.
customer_reviews.author: D. Black

customer_reviews.title: YESSSS
customer_reviews.text: this is an awesome heavy duty meat injector. I have no doubt that this will last for years. after buying cheep plastic ones at walmart and going through 2 or more of them in a year i thought I'd pay 16$ for a good one, and boy was i right. this is great and it comes with 2 different niddle sets for better and unique injections. also if the kids are acting out of line you can pull it out and tell them that you will give them a attuide adjustment shot when they see the size they will act like angels. lol.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Ashworth

customer_reviews.title: great syringe
customer_reviews.text: this this is awesome. Bought this a few years ago and its still in tip top shape.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: Let me start out by saying that if you're dressing as a crazy scientist or doctor for Halloween you one-hundred percent need this item. Nothing else will do. This is a great baster. It is very, very sturdy and feels well made. It comes with two needles, one for granular, the other for liquid. I have used jot twice and it is a pleasure to use. Cleanup is easy as well - just draw soapy water in, squirt it out, then run through the dishwasher. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: amznrvws101

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: This injector is great quality - easy to use - easy to clean and is packaged in a way that helps you keep the changeable tips and spare parts all in 1 place.
customer_reviews.author: E Rogers

customer_reviews.title: definitely better quality than I expected
customer_reviews.text: definitely better quality than I expected. Very solid construction thicker gauge stainless steel than I thought it would be deftly will hold up to repeated use. I'm injecting brisk it's with it have no complaints . I have broken quite a few in the past of cheaper constructed ones so far this once held up great. I think this one's is going to last a long time
customer_reviews.author: RichardLawson

customer_reviews.title: One of the needles has difficulty being screwed in. ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the needles has difficulty being screwed in. At first, we thought it would not go in at all. but after some tinkering, we found that the problem needle had to be positioned in a very particular starting position in order for it to screw in.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Injections rock!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, maybe I'm reviewing injections and not the product here to a small degree. In terms of the injector, no problems so far. I like the two different needles for different injections and I like that it breaks down to pieces. I've actually put it in the dishwasher a couple times with no problems. But yea, if you want to get into injecting your meat, all I can say is do it! Waaaaayyy better than marinating and keeps the meat juicy even if you only inject minutes before throwing it on the grill or in the oven.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Just shoot the bird...
customer_reviews.text: Worked as described and excellent job it performed. Only issue is that the length of plunger is a bit long -- and I have big hands. A bit larger diameter and shorter piston stroke would offer greater control and comfort I think.
customer_reviews.author: G. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this and got two of the same type of injector needle. I called the company expecting some automated hotline, but a REAL person answered, which was very nice. They quickly fixed the problem and it was no big deal. Customer service was GREAT! The injector works wonderfully, but people are right about the small o-ring seal on the tips. They do come off easily. I make sure to keep this in mind when I take it apart and wash it and so far it has been no big deal. It is a GREAT injector and definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian woman

customer_reviews.title: Well made and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy duty piece of equipment that is made well. The injection needles are about 6" long and penetrate meat easily. The needles are plenty long enough for the average home user.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Antolik

customer_reviews.title: Garbage product
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality product. Not stainless steel. Not precision quality. I can't even use one of the attachments because the threads drop right out the bottom. Both are very loose and leak liquid unless putting pressure on it. Absolute garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Koelker

customer_reviews.title: Turkeys love this...
customer_reviews.text: I mixed my own for 4 turkeys this Thanksgiving. Onion powder, garlic powder, black pepper, sriracha sauce, honey, sea salt, and soy sauce. I melt butter and mix it all then inject it in several places. I got a Masterbuilt 30" Electric Smoker in March and have used that much like a Crock Pot. I have cooked 3 of the 4 turkeys and have had rave reviews so far! This works well and is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: John W.

customer_reviews.title: Very good injector
customer_reviews.text: The Bayou Classic 5011 works really well. I've used it about 4 times so far. It feels solid and well made. I used a plastic one in the past so this is a big improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Tony N

customer_reviews.title: Great Injector - All stainless and silicone
customer_reviews.text: I could not be more pleased. This injector worked very well when I used it to add flavor to my turnkey before smoking. There are two marinade needles, one for crushed garlic and spices and another for liquids. Really people, if you put dense herbs and garlic in the needle for liquids, there will be blockages. Use the needles wisely and you will not have problems. I also love that it is all stainless and silicone. I would highly recommend this to anyone who is looking for a great quality injector at a decent price.
customer_reviews.author: M. Redhead

customer_reviews.title: Great tool - just make sure you need large needles
customer_reviews.text: I love this injector. All stainless except for the silicone washer, it is a great tool to have when brining meats and other uses. The only reason to take away a star was the size of the needles. For average chickens it is so large the brine leaks back out easily due to the diameter of the needle. It's great for large meat like turkeys, where there is more mass, but I'm going to try and find or fit a 18/19 gauge needle when using it for smaller birds.
customer_reviews.author: W. E. Beck

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: I finally had a chance to use this item and its defective. I checked to see if i could return it but i can't. The injector has no threads to screw on the injector needles. It's useless and not worth the purchase. What a waste of money.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Without a doubt the best injector I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: BRUCE POLIT

customer_reviews.title: works great! it dont get plugged like the little ones ...
customer_reviews.text: works great! it dont get plugged like the little ones do. and its farly easy to clean. some times it gets hard to operate after using it a couple times due to rubber o-ring and the stainless steel tube not being lubed up. before using it just spray some cooking spray into the case or cooking oil before putting the plunger in, and friends have bought some after watching the easy use
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: the needles are THICK, which it came with two ...
customer_reviews.text: the needles are THICK, which it came with two sizes instead of 2 diff styles. but it's high quality and thank god it comes with extra o-rings. havent needed them yet but be sure to dry it so it doesnt damage the rings over time
customer_reviews.author: CupOfRamen

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic kitchen tool
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend had an injector that he used all the time when making roast chicken. Then, it fell to the bottom of the dishwasher and melted on the heating elements. So for last Christmas, I thought a new one was in order, and picked this one because it's unmeltable! It's easy to use, easy to clean. Heavy duty which is great. Fool proof kitchen gadget that adds so much flavor without adding a lot of fat. We both use it, and I would pick this particular injector all over again if given the choice.
customer_reviews.author: H.F.

customer_reviews.title: Solid injector
customer_reviews.text: This injector feels sturdy & weighty in the hand. Very good 1/4 cup capacity. Needles are long and solid - no bends or breakage, and they're able to get deep into even the toughest meats. There's been no leaking yet in my usage. There are only a few plastic parts, but it is important to follow the instructions & keep this injector lubricated to keep those plastic parts from warping & causing leaks to happen.
customer_reviews.author: C. Christiansen

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice kit. Injected multiple type of beefs and porks. Had no splash back when done correctly, clean up is also easy.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: I like that it comes with 2 needles
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality injector. I like that it comes with 2 needles, 1 for liquid and 1 for minced marinade. No more needle jamming up with the herbs I use in some injections.ly recomend this product This also comes with a couple extra gasket rings for the injector so you'll not be squirting the injection out the end when it wears out. I high
customer_reviews.author: David A

customer_reviews.title: A great Injector for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: This meat injection set is a great deal!! It has two screw-on tips one being the liquid marinade tip and the second being the minced marinade tip. the stainless steel construction is great for all sanitary cooking uses. The 2 ounce marinade reservoir is easy to clean and is just right for BBQ's and Smokers. The seals are made of durable poly type material and hold up to frequent usage. I will tell all of my friends about this and most likely buy some as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: C Bill

customer_reviews.title: seems sturdy
customer_reviews.text: we loved our plastic flavor injector until it melted on the dishwasher element. Love to inject garlic pieces into my pork roast, along with rosemary. Makes the best pork roast ever. And now I can't melt the injector. This thing looks like a mid-evil torture item, but the taste of food injected with flavor is out of the this world. This one can be cleaned in boiling water if need be for greasy stuff too. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Barbie doll 7

customer_reviews.title: ... several different brands but this is by far the best one yet
customer_reviews.text: I have several different brands but this is by far the best one yet. As a master chef and one who lives off grid, every product I purchase must be flawless as there is no room for error. This product sports a 2oz capacity and enables you to inject marinade even with minced spices. Solid durable design, easy to handle I strongly recommend this to any chef/cook/BBQ person on any level!!
customer_reviews.author: Rick Rocker

customer_reviews.title: Stainless injector
customer_reviews.text: this is the best injector I own , it is easy to use and easy to clean , the two injector needles work great , the large bore needle is great for injecting thick spice sauces , the little injector needle is great for injecting liquids only . the beauty of the stainless steel is great on display in my kitchen. if your into injecting meats I Highly recommend this for any one . even if your new to using one this is the one you want .
customer_reviews.author: Joey De

customer_reviews.title: Works like you would expect
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy. Feels like it should cost more than it did. I have used this about 6 times so far with great success every time. Cleaning is very simple. They also included some extra O rings for when the first ones get worn out.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M

customer_reviews.title: good set that is solid.
customer_reviews.text: very solid injector. beats those plastic ones ive used in the past. only issue would be if you like bulky seasonings the multiport needle will handle only powered seasoning in the mix.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Injector
customer_reviews.text: All I would say if it had to be one word is,WOW!, This is a beautiful heavy duty unit that has large and solid injector needles (unlike the wimpy one Bbal uses eith thier turkey injector.) I cook quite a bit and have broken several of the smaller stainless steel ones(right at the crimp,needle to screw base) or tips snapping.Im sure This unit will give me years of service, It definitly is worth the 22.00 I paid for it,How's that old saying go "Boy I wish now I would of bought the one $20.00 dollar injector instead of the 4 $10.00 ones I broke the needles of off:("
customer_reviews.author: hjohnso248

customer_reviews.title: Not great metal quality.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for several years and then the threads gave out. Marinade blew out all over the kitchen counter and walks. Syringe needle threads must be made of pot metal. Not great quality considering the high rating by Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Broke after using it about 5 times. Save your money get a plastic one
customer_reviews.author: Nlakat13

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say......... I LOVE THIS THING! After previously using a plastic one, this thing is a dream! Love that it has two needles one of which allows for somewhat chunky sauces to go through. Need is nice and sharp, cleans easily, work very well! Packaging was also excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Vickie Haun

customer_reviews.title: Here's my juicy review....
customer_reviews.text: Product is well made. Threads seem secure. And it arrived with a spare set of the O-rings. Have used both needles without issue. The needle that has multiple holes does get clogged it the marinade has any chunks of anything in it. So the other needle is better for those types of injections. Overall I have been happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: T. Kirkwood

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for its price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product for its price. My husband used it to inject root hormones into rooting media in air layering. He loves the lateral holes along the needle and it helps in dispersing the solution into the rooting bag. He used petroleum jelly for lubrication instead of the oil, that way it doesn't contaminate the solution that much.
customer_reviews.author: Amyzonian

customer_reviews.title: Do yourself and favor and buy this it's nice and durable even comes with extra rings
customer_reviews.text: Do yourself and favor and buy this it's nice and durable even comes with extra rings. If you grill or smoke this is the injector you need
customer_reviews.author: David Messinger

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter-in-law to go with her new Turkey Deep Fryer and was very surprised at how classy it looked. It came in a nice package that made it look like a very expensive kitchen accessory. If it works as good as it looks, she will love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice...
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with the Bayou Classic... Receive them quickly wish and dried them.. put a little oil and waiting for my first brisket...
customer_reviews.author: RV_there?

customer_reviews.title: bought for Turkey
customer_reviews.text: My wife was looking for an injector and could not find one of high quality in any local store. Either they are plastic or something else of a cheap design. So I found this is Amazon and decided to give it a try, when it arrived I was surprised by the high quality construction. ease of use and clean up. But best of all this will be a long term investment and not a few uses and gone.
customer_reviews.author: ThatGuy !

customer_reviews.title: A worthwhile upgrade over the alternatives
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth the extra cash compared to the injectors you could get at some big box stores. Have used it to inject a brisket and turkey, and both were effortless with this product. The plunger can be a bit sticky when pushing it down at first, but as the instructions recommend lube the o-ring seals with vegetable oil prior to use to help alleviate this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Kind of disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I had high expectations for this. Unfortunately the seal leaks, even using vegetable oil as the packaging recommends. The metal is of good quality and it was easy to inject the meat. The problem is that 1/2 the marinade leaks out before I can inject it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Baker

customer_reviews.title: Dang glad I did
customer_reviews.text: Used this thing to season an entire pig for roasting. Dang glad I did. This thing worked awesome and got brine way up in the harder to reach places. Cant wait for the next pig roast!
customer_reviews.author: Malik

customer_reviews.title: Works great and will last forever
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother with cheap plastic that will not work when you need it. Total quality with spare replacement o rings
customer_reviews.author: mls

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE, THIS IS NOT THE DESCRIBED PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Father's day present and my family is out of state so I cannot accurately speak about the quality. However, I was extremely disappointed to learn that they included two of the same needles. They included the two of the needles with the hole only at the end of the syringe, but not the needle with wholes down the shaft. This is bait and switch! (which is illegal) but given the size of the the order it isn't worth returning, we still have a functional syringe after all.
customer_reviews.author: SWJ

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction, well built, and works excellent
customer_reviews.text: Solid replacement for a plastic injector that cracked and leaked on me. This is solid, and construction looks great. Have used it for 15 lbs of pork butt thus far, and it far exceeded expectations. Cannot wait to use again.
customer_reviews.author: K. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Great injector and large enough to accommodate spices!
customer_reviews.text: Great injector for meat. I smoke a lot of meat in the summer and use this on my pork shoulder to inject marinade into. I add a little spice to my marinade and this needle is large enough so it does not clog (think oregano). It's made very well and I ended up purchasing one for a pal who has a smoker too. Overall great!
customer_reviews.author: Regular Dad

customer_reviews.title: It started chipping the paint on the grooves of the ...
customer_reviews.text: It started chipping the paint on the grooves of the screw in part after the first use. I thought the entire thing was supposed to be stainless steel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Injector Around
customer_reviews.text: I love this injector. I made lemon and garlic mojo and injected it into our whole roast pork for Christmas Eve it worked perfect. It handled the big job perfectly. as I had to inject a lot of marinade into all of the pork and it weighed about 70 lbs. This stainless steel heavy duty injector did the job without any problems. I recomend anyone who needs to do a big job like this or even a large turkey or big piece of meat this is the one for them. Very happy with this injector. Julie Esquivel
customer_reviews.author: Juliann Esquivel

customer_reviews.title: Too BIG
customer_reviews.text: Although I have seen one reviewer said that it was too big but obviously I wanted to try for myself and yeah .....the needle insert is too big and there are like 20 holes on the other needle.... This thing is good for BIG piece of meat, like an cow leg or something, something like a 30lb turkey size..... To summarize, this is good for industrial use and not for small stuff
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Versatile injector
customer_reviews.text: Out of all the injectors I have had this is the only one that has held up more than a month... so there is that for starters. I am always careful with them and hand wash them, but inevitably their seals fail. This one has held up through many, many uses and the two different injector styles are really quite helpful, make it a very versatile tool.
customer_reviews.author: RF Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Finally an injector that doesn't fly apart while in use! I have a couple other injectors, one metal and one plastic, they broke easily. This one is holding up quite well and I really like the straight needle to pinpoint injection instead of using the needle with multiple holes in in it.
customer_reviews.author: S & L

customer_reviews.title: Literally fell apart
customer_reviews.text: The top cap that screws on to the main fluid chamber keeps popping off. It seems like it isn't threaded right or is too big. Any kind of consistent pulling on that cap (like when pulling the plunger out) will cause the cap to pull right off. I made it work for its first use then threw it in the trash. Spend a few extra bucks and get a better one.
customer_reviews.author: crgshum

customer_reviews.title: great addition to deep fryer
customer_reviews.text: it's a lot better than a plastic one..... have had 1 for 10 yrs. work's just fine also the price was great...
customer_reviews.author: zeke

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Used this to inject a Thanksgiving turkey with a recipe I found containing lots of finely minced herbs. This thing shot them through without clogging, no problem. Feels very sturdy. Very glad I purchased this. As long as whatever you're injecting is good, this thing will help make an awesome turkey. I shot it up the night before and let it sit in the fridge overnight, which worked great. High quality, great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ruprecht

customer_reviews.title: Great injector - handles chunky marinades well
customer_reviews.text: Best injector I have ever had. I have been doing cajun style turkeys for a long time. Gone through MANY different injectors and this one performed the best. I really like that it comes with two needles. One with a large diameter opening for chunky marinades and the other for pure liquid.
customer_reviews.author: ATL MCW

customer_reviews.title: Where Have You Been All My Life?
customer_reviews.text: After years of fumbling with the cheap plastic injectors that come free with jars of marinade, I finally bought a real injector. No more marinade and hot sauce exploding across my kitchen. On its maiden voyage I injected sun-dried tomato dressing into turkey breast. It worked liked a charm and the turkey was delicious. Clean-up was easy. I love this injector. It is ultra-sturdy and ought to last for years.
customer_reviews.author: M Wefer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my workshop for special projects like injecting glue and other liquids in tight spots. This unit is much larger than I expected. The tube is 1.25" in diameter and is 4" long. The probes are 5.5" long. It's very heavy but built very nice with stainless steel. It comes apart by unscrewing from the tube for easy cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: JG McClung

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Was very surprised by the quality of this. It is very well made. I would have preferred a thinner diameter needle but that is subjective.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Speedy shipping and worked great.
customer_reviews.text: I used this product for my thanks giving turkey. Even though I made the order 3 days before thanks giving day, prime 2 days shipping worked so well. Shipping was very speedy and made it for use on the day. Parts are detachable into 3 pieces to wash so cleaning is very easy. Also it's easy to put it together again. Although you have to squeeze tight to put it together, otherwise it doesn't go air tight and it's not going to suck the juice in proper way. Once it is air tight, it works very well and can inject yummy juices back to the turkey. This product is not so cheap but it absolutely worked great.
customer_reviews.author: M Pepulicimo E

customer_reviews.title: like the metal
customer_reviews.text: I had an earlier injector that was made out of a clear plastic. It cracked in the dishwasher after several uses, so I went searching for something a little more durable. This solve that problem and is almost perfect - I've used it a half dozen times with no real problem, although I'm careful when screwing it together. The threading feels thin enough that if I were to force it, I could damage it.
customer_reviews.author: David Bock

customer_reviews.title: Fancy box solid built great for the money
customer_reviews.text: Fancy box solid built great for the money. Goi g to buy another as spare down the line. Best I have had thus far.
customer_reviews.author: countrynerd

customer_reviews.title: Bought mine; then another for my neighbor
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Came with extra seals. Well made and worked extremely well!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Carlini

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many injectors and none of them meet the quality of the Bayou Classic. I am big into smoking (BBQ) so I needed a sturdy injector that can handle a variety of meats. I love the fact the Bayou Classic comes with two different injector needles. This is a great product. And for the price ... even better. A definite "thumbs up."
customer_reviews.author: M. Dolan

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have always been wanting one of these that had the different injector tips for all the different cuts of meat. Most of the free ones you get on the jars of injector marinade in the store does not have this extra tip and the capacity is to small. Recommend to anyone who likes injecting anything from a Turkey down to pork chops. Great deal!!!
customer_reviews.author: Strong Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Could use just a slight design improvement to make this product great!
customer_reviews.text: Not really designed for marinades with particles: minced garlic, sesame seeds, etc Tips of needles and needles themselves need to be thicker
customer_reviews.author: Rob Orolfo

customer_reviews.title: the needle clogs easily and needs a ton of pressure to inject anything ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems heavy duty but didn't work well for me, the needle clogs easily and needs a ton of pressure to inject anything from it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

product_meta.title: Bayou Classic 5011 2-Ounce Stainless-Steel Seasoning Injector with Marinade Needles
product_meta.description: Bayou Classic 2-oz Stainless Steel Seasoning Injector is the perfect way to completely and precisely flavor meat. Includes two stainless steel needles. One for liquid marinade and one needle for minced onion, garlic, etc. Prior to cooking; inject marinade into chicken, turkey, beef, or pork to enhance natural flavors. Easy to use and clean. Ideal for beginner and advanced backyard chefs.
feature_bullets: 2-ounce seasoning injector for moist, perfectly seasoned food
Sturdy stainless-steel construction to last year after year
Includes a liquid marinade needle and a minced marinade needle
Perfect for beginner and advanced cooks

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,583 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
